alert.note: Alert for Grant; Hot Spring; Jefferson; Lonoke; Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 9:11AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Lonoke, Grant, northwestern Jefferson, southeastern Saline, northeastern Hot Spring and southeastern Pulaski Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 910 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Southwest Little Rock to Haskell. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... Benton... West Little Rock... Bryant... Downtown Little Rock... Sheridan... Southwest Little Rock... Haskell... Shannon Hills... England... Wrightsville... Redfield... Traskwood... Leola... Tull... Prattsville... Poyen... Keo... Otter Creek... Cane Creek... This includes the following highways... Interstate 30 between mile markers 106 and 140. Interstate 430 between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 530 between mile markers 1 and 26. Interstate 630 between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 440 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Grant; Hot Spring; Jefferson; Lonoke; Pulaski; Saline
